sen.j: 森近 運平（もりちか うんぺい、1881年1月20日 - 1911年1月24日）は社会主義者。
sen.e: Unpei MORICHIKA (January 20, 1881 - January 24, 1911) is a known socialist.
Unpei MORICHIKA (January 20, 1881 - January 24, 1911) was a socialist.
sen.cmt: is→was としました。known を削除しました。
sen.e: Unpei MORICHIKA (January 20, 1881 - January 24, 1911) was a socialist.

sen.j: 幸徳事件で処刑された12名の1人。
sen.e: He is one of the 12 convicts of those who were executed for Kotoku Incident.

sen.j: 1907年宮武外骨の支援により『大阪平民新聞』創刊。
sen.e: He started publishing "Osaka Heimin (commoner) Shinbun (Newspaper)" in 1907, with the support of Gaikotsu MIYATAKE.

sen.j: 1909年幸徳秋水など同志と倫理観で対立し、岡山に帰郷。
sen.e: He returned to his home region, Okayama Prefecture after he opposed to the ethics of his fellow member, Shusui KOTOKU.
In 1909, he returned to his home region, Okayama Prefecture, after he opposed to the ethics of his fellow members: Shusui KOTOKU and so on.

sen.e: In 1909, he returned to his home region, Okayama Prefecture, after he opposed to the ethics of his fellow members: Shusui KOTOKU and so on.

sen.j: 地元で当時高等園芸と言われた温室栽培など農業改良運動に従事した。
sen.e: Since then, he worked on the improvement activities on agriculture by developing a greenhouse cultivation system, which was still an advanced horticulture in those days.
Since then, he worked there on the improvement activities on agriculture by developing a greenhouse cultivation system, which was still an advanced horticulture in those days, and so on.
sen.cmt: 「地元で」の部分に対応するため there を追加しました。and so on を追加しました。
sen.e: Since then, he worked there on the agricultural improvement activities by developing a greenhouse cultivation system, which was still an advanced horticulture in those days, and so on.
sen.cmt: on the improvement activities on agriculture →on the agricultural improvement activitiesとしました。

sen.j: 1910年の大逆事件で逮捕された。
sen.e: He was arrested for Kotoku Incident in 1910.
He was arrested for the High Treason Incident in 1910.
sen.cmt: 「大逆事件」訳語変更しました。
sen.e: He was arrested for the High Treason Incident in 1910.

sen.j: 地元の農民は無実を信じ、教育者、宗教者であり、遠縁にもあたりかねてより森近を良く知る佐藤範雄に助命を依頼。
sen.e: The local farmers believed in the false accusation regarding this arrest, and they implored Norio SATO, who was the distant relative of MORICHIKA to know him well and also a well-known educator and religious person, to spare the life of MORICHIKA.

The local farmers believed his innocence, and they implored Norio SATO, who was the distant relative of Morichika to know him well and also a well-known educator and religious person, to spare the life of Morichika.
sen.cmt: 「無実を信じ」の部分を訳し直しました。森近の姓を2009/6/29指示の表記としました。
sen.e: The local farmers believed his innocence, and they implored Norio SATO, who was the distant relative of Morichika to know him well and also a well-known educator and religious person, to spare the life of Morichika.

sen.j: 要請を受けた佐藤は岡山県知事、警察部長と打ち合わせ上京、警保局長有松英樹に対して助命嘆願をしたが、判決の6日後1911年（明治44年）1月24日に刑が執行された。
sen.e: After the request of those farmers, SATO discussed with the Prefectural governor and the police general of Okayama Prefecture, and headed to Tokyo to plea for sparing the life of MORICHIKA to the chief of the National Public Safety Bureau, Hideki ARIMATSU; however, the death penalty was carried out on January 24, 1911, 6 days after the judgement.
sen.cmt: 警保局は国家公安委員会の前身であると思われますが、英語にて説明されている文献を見つけられません。"National Public Safety Bureau"としてみましたが、意訳となります。
sen.e: After the request of those farmers, Sato discussed with the Prefectural governor and the police general of Okayama Prefecture, and headed to Tokyo to make a plea for sparing the life of Morichika to the chief of the National Public Safety Bureau, Hideki ARIMATSU; however, the death penalty was carried out on January 24, 1911, six days after the judgment.
sen.cmt: 佐藤と森近の姓を2009/6/29指示の表記としました。plea の前に make a を追加しました。6をスペルアウトとしました。judgment 米国スペルとしました。
sen.e: After the request of those farmers, Sato discussed with the Prefectural governor and the chief of Okayama Prefectural Police., and headed to Tokyo to make a plea for sparing the life of Morichika to the chief of the National Public Safety Bureau, Hideki ARIMATSU; however, the death penalty was carried out on January 24, 1911, six days after the judgment.
sen.cmt: the police general→the chief of Okayama Prefectural Policeとしました。
